title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.19 | 21-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Gyanatimiran Dasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Galadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravatha Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Gyanatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 19th verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Dharma in the form of a bull asked madam addressing the cow.
Are you not hale and hearty?
Why are you covered with the shadow of grief?
It appears by your face that you have become black.
Are you suffering from some internal disease?
Or are you thinking of some relative who is away in a distant place?
So this symbolic representation of the condition of human society reflected in the condition of the cow.
The representative of mother earth, the cow.
And even the condition of the bull, that will be described in the next verse, the condition of the bull.
So dharma is inquiring from mother earth.
This is a respectful way of addressing a lady in the samsara.
Are you not hale and hearty?
Are you not keeping good health?
Why are you covered with the shadow of grief?
That means not only is mother earth unhappy.
But she is unhappy about something which seems like it is a cause for distress or unhappiness.
Continues to linger for a long time.
It's not something which comes and immediately goes away.
That momentarily there is some pain and after the cause for the pinprick is removed then the pain is gone.
You are covered with the shadow of grief.
And it appears by your face that you have become black.
That means the pain has been there.
The problem of this cause for the pain has been there.
The problem of this cause for the pain has been there.
The problem of this cause for the pain has been there.
The problem of this cause for the pain has been there.
And your face has become black because you have been suffering for quite some time.
Are you suffering from some internal disease?
And what is the cause of your pain?
Is there some disease that has afflicted you?
Or are you thinking of some relative who is away in a distant place?
Or are you thinking of some relative who is away in a distant place?
You are separated from your relative.
And you are not able to live together happily.
And you are not able to actually be together due to some reason.
So Aushriya Prabhupada very nicely explains.
That this exactly reflects the condition of people in this present age Kali Yuga.
We can relate with it because as Prabhupada explains.
This is our position today in Kali Yuga.
Shriya Prabhupada says in the purport.
The people of the world in this age of Kali are always full of anxieties.
In the beginning of the first chapter.
When the sages Naimisharanya could foresee the conditions of people in Kali Yuga.
At the end of Dwapar Yuga.
Then they were anxiously inquiring from Suta Goswami.
What is the remedy for people's problems in Kali Yuga.
Because these saintly persons they are called sadhus.
And sadhus means they live for welfare of others.
They themselves are situated in Krishna consciousness.
God consciousness so they are happy.
And they have solved their problems by God consciousness.
But they can't tolerate to see the suffering.
Of the other people who are not in God consciousness.
Who suffers in this material world especially in Kali Yuga.
Those who are not God conscious.
So the saintly persons who are happy because of being God conscious.
They can't tolerate to see the suffering of others.
To remove the suffering of the people in general.
How can their suffering be removed?
This is the position of the sadhu.
Sadhu is not a person with a big beard.
That is not a real sadhu.
Those may be external symbols to indicate to somebody else that I am a sadhu.
But real symptom of a sadhu is.
He is unhappy because of others unhappiness.
Because a devotee by practicing Krishna consciousness.
He is always happy in Krishna consciousness.
Krishna is the servitor of his devotees.
So a devotee of Krishna has no reason to.
Be unhappy on his own account.
But he is unhappy looking at the condition of the suffering souls.
Who are bereft of God consciousness.
So in this age of Kali.
The sages of Naimisharan were pointing out to Suta Goswami.
People are always disturbed in the mind.
That means the mind is full of anxieties.
That is what Prabhupada is telling here.
The people of the world in this age of Kali are always full of anxieties.
Some reason will be there for them to be filled with anxiety.
So it is said here by Srila Prabhupada.
Everyone is diseased with some kind of ailment.
And hospital beds are not available.
Specially during the pandemic and after the pandemic.
People are suffering in so many ways.
Some people have some kidney problem.
Some people have got high blood pressure.
So they are susceptible to fall sick.
Because of not having the necessary nourishment.
I mean I can go on like this.
It can be very lengthy tale of woe.
People suffer in so many ways in this present age.
Very few people are very healthy.
From the very faces of the people of this age.
One can find out the index of the mind.
This is another saying in the scriptures.
The face is the index of the mind.
If you look at somebody's face.
You can understand whether they are internally happy or not happy.
You look at the face of people in general in Kali Yuga.
You can make out that they are not happy.
Everyone feels the absence of his relative who is away from home.
Because of some anxiety that they go through.
Second symptom is being described here.
They have some kind of ailment.
Or some kind of skin rashes.
Poor health of the people in general.
Everyone practically feels the absence of his or her relative who is away from home.
The particular symptom of the age of Kali is that.
No family is now blessed to live together.
The father lives at a place far away from the son.
From one city to another city.
She has to work in a different location.
Is working in a different location.
And both of them have to work for making ends meet.
Although they can't maintain the family.
The family members are not together.
They are not able to stay together.
There are sufferings from internal suffering.
from internal diseases separation from those near and dear anxieties for
maintaining the status quo proper summarizes three specific problems of
people in Kali Yuga mentioned in this verse these are but some important
factors which make the people of this age always unhappy that's reflected in
the condition of the cow mother earth appeared in the form of a cow so I'll
stop here thank you very much Hare Krishna
